definition: to open one's mouth/to start talking
variant of 啟|启[qi3]
to open/to start/to initiate/to enlighten or awaken/to state/to inform
variant of 啟|启[qi3]
Qi son of Yu the Great 禹[Yu3], reported founder of the Xia Dynasty 夏朝[Xia4 Chao2] (c. 2070-c. 1600 BC)
tooth/CL:顆|颗[ke1]
to be too embarrassed to mention sth (idiom)/to find it hard to speak about sth
to be too shy to speak one's mind (idiom)

sentences.english: Ling is a reluctant to see red fruits jie who, in the heart very length is not happy.
sentences.chinese: 凌桀看到红果一启齿就长短凡，心里很不快乐。

sentences.english: You might say, "I have something difficult to tell you.
sentences.chinese: 你可能说，“我有一些难以启齿的话想要告诉你。

sentences.english: Nonetheless, many parents have a difficult time discussing this topic.
sentences.chinese: 尽管如此，许多父母讨论这个话题时还是难于启齿。

sentences.english: The younger instructor stood in front of the students red with embarrassment, unable to broach the subject.
sentences.chinese: 小科代表害羞的红着脸站在全班同学面前，难以启齿。

sentences.english: Some people even think that talking about sex is a big no-no.
sentences.chinese: 更有一些人认为谈论性是大大的难以启齿的行为。

sentences.english: I'll find the people to help do it.
sentences.chinese: 求人帮忙实在叫他难于启齿。

sentences.english: Too shy to say those three little words in person?
sentences.chinese: 这小小的三个字，你是否羞于当面启齿？

sentences.english: China is a olutely right I'm ashamed to admit.
sentences.chinese: 羞于启齿，但我得承认，中国绝对是正确的。

sentences.english: China is absolutely right I'm ashamed to admit.
sentences.chinese: 羞于启齿，但我得承认，中国绝对是正确的。

sentences.english: Some of the hypocrisy in the Arab world is unspeakable.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉伯世界中的某些伪善是无法启齿的。

sentences.english: It can be a difficult subject to talk about.
sentences.chinese: 这可能是个难以启齿的话题。

sentences.english: Although the nights out, but have forgotten that she was ashamed of how open lips.
sentences.chinese: 虽然夜明，但还是忘记了，她是怎样开唇启齿的。

sentences.english: I let them fire away. I taught them to ask still more ticklish questions.
sentences.chinese: 我让他们不停地问，我教他们提出更难以启齿的问题。

sentences.english: You may be too tired to change it up, or too shy to ask for what you want.
sentences.chinese: 也可能是太累了你懒得变，又或者你难于启齿。

sentences.english: It was Fatso who first spoke of the unspeakable thing.
sentences.chinese: 这件难以启齿的事还是让胖嫂先说穿了。

sentences.english: While she felt like joining in the argument, Nancy was too shy to open her mouth.
sentences.chinese: 南希虽然浑如参加辩论，但忸怩得不敢启齿。

definition: to be too shy to speak one's mind (idiom)
to be too embarrassed to mention sth (idiom)/to find it hard to speak about sth
embarrassed
to hum and haw (idiom); to mumble as if hiding sth/to speak and break off, then start again/to hold sth back
shy/timid
coy/shy/bashful
to stammer/to mumble/to speak haltingly
to tell/to disclose/to reveal
to show signs of reluctance or embarrassment
to knit one's brows/to frown
to respond evasively or vaguely/to elude/to stall
to resist/to deal with
to forget
(idiom) to talk in a roundabout way to cover up the truth/evasive
to blurt out without thinking (idiom)
a hidden trouble hard to mention (idiom)/sth too embarrassing to mention/an embarrassing illness
fish bone stuck in one's throat (idiom); fig. to feel obliged to speak out candidly/sth on one's mind
